DataElement.preferredName: Treatment Satisfaction Questionnaire for Medication (TSQM-9) Over Last Week Confidence that Taking Medication is a Good Thing Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how how confident overall they have been over the last week that taking the medication is a good thing for them, using a five point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Treatment Satisfaction Questionnaire for Medication (TSQM-9) Over Last Week Confidence that Taking Medication is a Good Thing Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 9 question subset of the Treatment Satisfaction Questionnaire for Medication that omits the five items of the side effects domain.:Being above or beyond something._Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining._Any period of seven consecutive days._A question about how confident an individual is that taking the medication is a good thing._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A 9 question subset of the Treatment Satisfaction Questionnaire for Medication that omits the five items of the side effects domain.

Concepts.definition: A 9 question subset of the Treatment Satisfaction Questionnaire for Medication that omits the five items of the side effects domain.

Property.preferredName: Over Last Week Confidence that Taking Medication is a Good Thing Score
Property.preferredDefinition: No Value Exists:Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.:Any period of seven consecutive days.:A question about how confident an individual is that taking the medication is a good thing.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.
Any period of seven consecutive days.

Concepts.longName: Confidence that Taking Medication is a Good Thing
Concepts.definition: A question about how confident an individual is that taking the medication is a good thing.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A five point Likert scale from not at all confident to extremely confident.
